head.title: Update Center: Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) Information – Community – Castaic Union School District

meta.name: description
meta.content:
Castaic Union School District serves students and is located in Valencia, CA.
The Castaic Union School District, in partnership with the community, provides children with a creative and collaborative learning environment supported by a safe and nurturing atmosphere that creates life-long learners and empowers them to be critical thinkers in a global community.

'https://ssl' : 'http://www') + '.google-analytics.com/ga.js'; var s = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0]; s.parentNode.insertBefore(ga, s); })();

li.a: Know a Child with Special Needs?

img.alt: Social Media post, We're In This Together

p.span: We realize that the outbreak of the coronavirus and its impact worldwide have created many concerns for you and your family. At Castaic Union School District, we want to help alleviate some of that anxiety by providing as much information and as many resources as we can to support you during this time. Please continue to follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, for information about our Grab n Go lunch program (available to ALL school children), P.E. with Mrs. Z, Storytime with Mrs. Maxon, and many other opportunities for your children to stay connected.

Please know that we are committed to the success and well-being of your children as we work together to educate them through distance learning with our virtual classrooms and online support. Please contact your children's teachers with any questions you may have as we are truly in this together and are confident that together we will succeed.
We will continue to update this webpage as more tools and information become available.

Formerly called Food for Thought Pantry

span.strong: Domestic Violence Prevention Program of Child and Family Center

p.span: Emergency shelter for abused women and their children, providing counseling, and a batterer’s intervention program.
Providing shelter and assistance to families in need.
Providing support services and emergency shelter to individuals and families.
Providing short-term assistance of low and economically challenged clients in the form of food, clothing, utility assistance, transportation, lodging assistance.
Sliding-fee based on income and accepting MediCal; appointments or walk-ins. No insurance necessary.
